10 Biggest Mistakes Posting on OnlyFans

10 Biggest Mistakes Posting on OnlyFans

What do your subscribers view on every post you put up on OnlyFans?

10 Biggest Mistakes Posting On Instagram as a Content Creator

Estimated Reading Time: 2 min 21 sec

To grow your OnlyFans brand, you have to enhance your online presence on social platforms like Instagram. There are over a billion active users on Instagram, most of which are very competitive, with smart strategies that help them excel on the platform. 

Being a visual platform, you must ensure that you post clear visuals on Instagram to attract people to all your posts. With attraction and engagement, you can reach your target audience and grow your following through viral posts.

A slight mistake on Instagram can cost you your success. And it’s easy to make that one mistake if you aren’t keen on your promotion strategies. This post highlights the most common mistakes you can make while posting your content on Instagram.

But first, let’s explore the benefits of promoting on Instagram.

Make an appointment now

5 Benefits of Promoting on Instagram

Promoting on Instagram means engaging your followers and converting them into paying subscribers. The most exciting thing about the platform is its trendiness amongst millennials. As we know, millennials comprise a significant part of the entire consumer market. 

As an OnlyFans content creator, it’s crucial to capitalize on Instagram to boost your following and income.

Here is how promoting on Instagram can benefit your OnlyFans: 

1. Helps You Establish and Build Brand Awareness

Instagram is one of the social platforms with the broadest user base. It also has a media-centric persona that you can leverage to familiarize your brand with potential subscribers. With engagement and consistency, you have the opportunity to succeed in luring more people to your Instagram page and redirecting them to your OnlyFans.

With strong brand awareness and recognition, people will always have you in mind when considering the content relevant to their needs. It will be easier to recognize your brand voice, aesthetics and values and make communication easier.

Telling your brand and product story in a consistent manner will impact the way people consume your content. Brand voice matters when you’re planning to target followers based on their demographics.

It is also important to define who you are and what you stand for so your followers have a clear view of who they’re relating with. Your brand values should be in line with what your fans want. This is true to what the Edelman Trust Barometer says – that 58% of buyers trust and purchase products from brands based on the beliefs and values of the brand.

2. Increase in Web Traffic

When creating your account on Instagram, include your OnlyFans URL in your bio. This will help redirect followers to your page and prompt them to subscribe. The more people visiting your OnlyFans, the higher the conversion and returns. It will also improve your Google ranking and overall online exposure.

3. Increased Paid Subscriptions

Posting on Instagram is the best way to promote your OnlyFans brand online. As long as you nail the fundamentals, your online presence, following, and revenue will increase tremendously.

If your followers love your content, they will share it with others on their social profiles. They will become your ambassadors on the ground and make your products go viral. In turn, you’ll increase your lead generation, productivity, and overall bottom line.

4. The Chance to Showcase Your Brand 

Instagram provides a platform with many opportunities to showcase your OnlyFans brand and products. You can tell your brand story and be viewed by followers who want to engage with you. This is especially helpful when you’re teasing the launch of your products.

Telling your brand story is a great way to convince people to subscribe to your OnlyFans. In the end, you’ll experience tremendous growth in your sales. 

5. Precise Targeting

Instagram encourages precise targeting of followers by location, interest, behavior, demographics, etc. This way, you can create a buyer persona and create posts that resonate with what they want. 

Once you know your audience, it will be easy to target content based on their needs. It will help you build a loyal following you can count on for revenue generation.

Now that you know how posting on Instagram benefits your OnlyFans, let’s delve further into the biggest posting mistakes you can make on Instagram and how you can avoid them.

Keep scrolling.

Make an appointment now

10 Biggest Mistakes to Avoid When Posting on Instagram

1. Creating a Private Instagram Account

When looking to promote your OnlyFans, you want to capture every opportunity that comes your way. You have to start by making your Instagram account accessible to people. This opens up limitless opportunities to pull out prospects, reach out to other audiences, and increase your follower base.

If potential subscribers find your page set to private, they’ll stay away or wait until you log in and accept their friendship request. A private icon shows them they should steer clear, which can harm business.

An open account allows people to view, share and comment on your content without restrictions.

2. Not Writing a Detailed Bio and Failing to Add Your OnlyFans Link in the Bio

Your Instagram bio is your introduction as a creator and a brand. This is your only chance to tell followers who you are and what your brand is all about. Make them know and understand what you’re offering if they decide to follow you.

Put your personality into your bio description to give people a sense of your brand voice, values, and philosophy. You can convince people that interacting with your OnlyFans brand is worth their while. 

Here’s what to include in your Instagram bio:

  • Your brand name
  • A precise introduction/description of your business
  • The link to your OnlyFans
  • Emoticons and bullets to use as identifying marks
  • Your brand’s hashtags.

What’s the point of promoting on Instagram if you can’t redirect your fans to your OnlyFans page? A link in your bio will guide your followers throughout the sales funnel. Instagram permits you to include one link, which is crucial to lead generation.

People who like your brand will likely want to follow or subscribe to you. You gain many opportunities to build your following with a link on your bio. Always add your page link to your bio to get more page views and traffic.

3. Failing to Engage with Your Followers

Follower engagement is key to subscriber retention and consistent growth. When you interact with followers at a more personal level, they get to know you better, like your posts, and convert to paying OnlyFans subscribers who eventually become your brand ambassadors. In return, you get the chance to know their pain points and what they expect from you and eventually address them accordingly.

When on Instagram, focus on getting creative and finding time to connect with prospects and loyal followers. Most people interested in your posts will like or comment on them. This is an effective way of building a large following. They expect a response from you to know if their input is recognized and appreciated. If they don’t receive a reaction, they will move to a competitor’s page.

You must maintain connections. Be wise and post feedback on their reactions. They’ll be willing to share their experience with others when they find you interactive and engaging. Always connect with your Instagram audience to spark their interest. Reply to their comments, ask for their opinion, and let them know that you care. Once they know you, they’ll follow you to your OnlyFans. 

The more you engage with people, the easier it will be to turn them into loyal OnlyFans subscribers. Keep those conversations going and boost your profitability.

4. Posting Low-Quality Visuals

Instagram is driven by visuals. Posts on the platform get attention due to catchy photos and videos. Today’s content consumer is attracted to videos and photos that make sense. Only upload high-resolution content as it reduces peoples’ brand perception.

The best rule of thumb is to post clear, average-sized visuals that look crisp when scaled down. Always consider your visuals’ lighting, setup, composition, and background. This will help to make an impact on everyone watching them. Spend time tweaking and editing all visuals before posting to ensure they are significantly impactful.

Posting low-quality photos can be a turn-off for many. Visuals will only tell an interesting brand story when they appear captivating. Besides editing, post them consistently to make people understand your story better. 

As much as possible, refrain from posting duplicate content. Your audience looks forward to finding something new on your page, so don’t disappoint them by replicating content. They’ll be quick to unfollow you if they realize you are not satisfying their needs.  Strive to keep your posts unique and entertaining. Your followers will love you for your relevance, quality, and uniqueness.

5. Not Utilizing the ‘Instagram Story’ Feature 

Instagram has an IGTV, and Instagram story features to capture people’s attention. Long-form videos help to deliver information in a much more captivating, delectable way. The stories feature lets you share your moments without much clutter on your profile.

IGTV is the real deal when it comes to content promotion. Focus on creating quality, descriptive content, including live streams and explainers, to build your brand credibility. You can run a fully-fledged promotional campaign right inside your Instagram page and sell your OnlyFans.

6. Misusing Hashtags

Hashtags are great social media marketing tools. They allow people to find content quickly. When you encourage your followers to use hashtags, you can show appreciation by reposting your page’s hashtagged images.

In a nutshell, 

  • Hashtags can boost your content visibility
  • They work wonders when it comes to creating brand awareness
  • They also simplify content tracking
  • With hashtags, it’s easy to engage followers
  • Use hashtags to create content and promote events. For your OnlyFans, this is an excellent way of gaining more fans. 

However, you cannot misuse hashtags on Instagram. Too many hashtags can look spammy. On Instagram, you are allowed to use 30 hashtags for every post you create. Even so, these can be overwhelming for a single post.  Don’t lose your credibility by misusing your hashtags. Eleven or slightly more hashtags can get you up to 80% interaction. 

When planning your hashtags, choose the most popular and relevant to your brand marketing. They should be searchable and quite impactful. Customize all your hashtags based on the particular content you’ll be posting next. Consider using long-tail and branded keywords to get your OnlyFans brand noticed.

7. Not Staying Consistent

Frequent posting on Instagram is key to amassing a large following. Schedule your posts and maintain consistent posting at all times. This will help you connect with more prospective subscribers. Plan your content and tweak your presentation styles to attract more attention.

Develop a plan for creating and scheduling your content to maintain your follower engagement. If you use boomerangs today, try another format the next day, and so on. Don’t stop or skip posting, as you’ll lose touch with your followers.

Keep track of follower behavior to know the best times to post content. Your posts should catch followers when they’re active on Instagram.

8. Buying Followers and Likes

A lot of sites offer irresistible deals to purchase massive followers. Buying followers seems like an enticing venture. But what you need to ask yourself is, how will you engage with such an audience? While purchasing a following seems good, such an audience may never engage with your content. These fake Instagram accounts or bots will never comment on or like your content.

Purchasing followers and likes devalue your pages, especially before the Instagram algorithm. In the end, you’ll have no ranking, credibility, influence, and, most important, OnlyFans following and revenue.

Rather than finding a shortcut to success, focus on growing your fan base by posting captivating content using the best marketing practices on Instagram.

9. Focusing on Yourself While Promoting Too Hard

Nothing puts off prospects as quickly as an aggressive marketer who pushes them into purchasing products. Users only want to watch videos and view pictures when visiting Instagram pages. Don’t reply to people’s comments by demanding that they follow or share content about buying your products. All they want from you is a steady flow of valuable content. You don’t need to promote so hard while pressuring them to take action.

Keep off the salesy tone. Focus on being conversational and engaging with everyone directly. It’s okay to add a link or call to action, but nothing more. Humanize your OnlyFans brand and post live streams of your business behind the scenes. This will show your audience that your business has a face.

Don’t divert your focus, and start promoting yourself. Remember why you’re on Instagram in the first place – to promote your OnlyFans. To do this, talk to your followers to contribute ideas for your campaigns, run contests, and curate compelling content.

Your audience will gauge your selflessness and be interested in working with you toward your worthy cause.

10. Don’t Turn a Blind Eye to Analytics

Analytics is very important to your success on Instagram. It can help you get insights into follower behavior and work towards improving the weakest areas of your promotional campaign. 

Using analytics, you’ll be able to know the posts with the most shares, likes, and comments. When you keep track of this information, you’ll streamline your posting to match the needs of your followers. 

Analytics encourage real-time engagement, which is what you need to build a loyal following. Never ignore Instagram analytics; they have the solution you need to increase engagement with your followers. Track your metrics to understand what you should do to improve your Instagram posts. 

Posting on Instagram the Right Way

Preventing posting mistakes on Instagram can be overwhelming for creators with tight schedules. That’s why Fandafia OnlyFans Agency is here to help you maneuver Instagram without any mistakes.

Hiring Fandafia to manage your Instagram account will ensure you promote your Onlyfans page successfully and gain a larger following, increased sales, and revenue.

The agency has specialized teams that work together for the success of your OnlyFans.
